message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI

This paper is related to natural language processing and text mining, which are the main topics of the computer science sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper proposes a new structure for joint sentiment-topic modeling based on a neural network, which falls under the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses information retrieval, which is a topic in the sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The proposed model is supervised and trained by the Contrastive Divergence algorithm, which is a common algorithm in the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper proposes a new layer with the multinomial probability distribution, which can be used in text data sentiment classification, which is a topic in the sub-category cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
